newsitem.title: BELARUS: Belarus 1996 grain crop 6.5 mln tonnes vs 5.6 mln.
newsitem.headline: Belarus 1996 grain crop 6.5 mln tonnes vs 5.6 mln.

text.p: Belarus has harvested 6.5 million tonnes of grain, in line with forecasts and against 5.6 million last year, Deputy Agriculture Minister Ivan Shokolo said on Thursday.
"The grain harvest is finished and we have gathered 6.5 million tonnes," he told Reuters.
Agriculture Minister Vasily Leonov said earlier this month that the former Soviet republic expected to import about 500,000 tonnes of wheat this year, most probably from Ukraine.
The private sector accounted for about 500,000 tonnes of Belarus's 1996 crop.
Shokolo said Belarus had finished its winter sowing campaign of mostly winter wheat and some rye and barley, and planned to increase output to 7.5 million tonnes next year.

"Belarus has successfully completed its sowing campaign of 1.147 million hectares this autumn against 1.106 million hectares last year," Shokolo said. "We plan to increase the use of fertiliser by 80 percent."
He said they would try to raise yields to three tonnes per hectare in 1997 from 2.5 tonnes this year.
"If we reach this harvest figure then Belarus will be able to meet all of its domestic grain needs and we can avoid imports," said Shokolo.
Sown winter grain was developing normally, he added.
